subs.text:
@markos That was exactly what GHW Bush did, he should have gotten the Nobel Peace prize. 

It didn't last, subsequent administrations really did a number on Russia, forgetting they have a vast nuclear arsenal.
subs.rawText:
@markos That was exactly what GHW Bush did, he should have gotten the Nobel Peace prize. 

It didn't last, subsequent administrations really did a number on Russia, forgetting they have a vast nuclear arsenal.

subs.text: @sarahkendzior @gaslitnation What he wants it seems to me is recognition that Russia's nuclear weapons entitles it to all the power that the USSR has. He's been ignored when he says that. So it's somewhat rational to say okay if you won't respect my nukes, I'm going to force you to consider them.
subs.rawText: @sarahkendzior @gaslitnation What he wants it seems to me is recognition that Russia's nuclear weapons entitles it to all the power that the USSR has. He's been ignored when he says that. So it's somewhat rational to say okay if you won't respect my nukes, I'm going to force you to consider them.

subs.text:
@sarahkendzior @gaslitnation I think basically he's winding the clock back to the Cuban Missile Crisis and insisting we play it out again. 

He thinks that will result in him achieving his goal. I think so too, and I think Biden does as well. That's why the demands for a no-fly zone are crazy.
subs.rawText:
@sarahkendzior @gaslitnation I think basically he's winding the clock back to the Cuban Missile Crisis and insisting we play it out again. 

He thinks that will result in him achieving his goal. I think so too, and I think Biden does as well. That's why the demands for a no-fly zone are crazy.

subs.text: @jeffjarvis There are lots of elephants like that, deals the west ignored. It's a complicated situation, and the press isn't beginning to cover the complexities.
subs.rawText: @jeffjarvis There are lots of elephants like that, deals the west ignored. It's a complicated situation, and the press isn't beginning to cover the complexities.

subs.text:
@scobleizer -- I use Amazon Music. 

Anyway I notice they now have Dolby Atmos. 

I have an iPhone 13 Pro and AirPod Pro.

Am I getting the full Scobleizer treatment or do I have to get Apple Music too?

subs.text:
Imagine a peace conference in a few weeks, with the Ukraine and Russia, the EU, NATO and of course the US. 

One thing the US wants is to be sure Russia stays out of our elections in the future, maybe some reparations for the damage they did in 2016. 

That has not been settled.
subs.rawText:
Imagine a peace conference in a few weeks, with the Ukraine and Russia, the EU, NATO and of course the US. 

One thing the US wants is to be sure Russia stays out of our elections in the future, maybe some reparations for the damage they did in 2016. 

That has not been settled.

subs.text: @AndreaBNYC @MaraGay Indeed. Some news org should rewrite the story of the 2016 election given all we know now about Putin and Ukraine that we didn't know then.
subs.rawText: @AndreaBNYC @MaraGay Indeed. Some news org should rewrite the story of the 2016 election given all we know now about Putin and Ukraine that we didn't know then.

subs.text:
I never thought to look until just now but..

Alexa has an audio-out mini jack.

I have a pair of Audioengine speakers not in use. 

Voila -- Amazon Music with some real sound. 

I'm giving it to my Peloton.

BTW, did my 100th ride yesterday.

You could say I'm hooked.

subs.text: BTW #toolsforthought people, my OPML-based search engine, Daytona, can give me all my blocks that ref Peloton, in an outline. [link] I did not have to enter [[Peloton]] to be able to access it this way. This has been a revelation.
subs.rawText:
BTW #toolsforthought people, my OPML-based search engine, Daytona, can give me all my blocks that ref Peloton, in an outline.

https://t.co/2jFCyTZk3q

I did not have to enter [[Peloton]] to be able to access it this way. This has been a revelation.

subs.text: I love it. Decades of writing available this way.

subs.text: @jeffjarvis I took a political science in college, was thinking of being a major. When they got around to polling, what was made clear was you could get people to say whatever you want by how you asked the question.
subs.rawText: @jeffjarvis I took a political science in college, was thinking of being a major. When they got around to polling, what was made clear was you could get people to say whatever you want by how you asked the question.

subs.text:
@jeffjarvis For example if they asked this question.

1. Do you think Americans should support the president in times of war, regardless of party? 

And then..

2. Do you approve of how President Biden is handling the war in Ukraine?

You'd get the patriotic answer inside every American.
subs.rawText:
@jeffjarvis For example if they asked this question.

1. Do you think Americans should support the president in times of war, regardless of party? 

And then..

2. Do you approve of how President Biden is handling the war in Ukraine?

You'd get the patriotic answer inside every American.
